Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of faded rosette in added white outline with added red centre above band of undetermined pattern between white lines; exterior: painted decoration consisting of standing sphinx (parts of head, neck, hair, wing, front legs and body remaining; all fired orange-red), to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme. Lemos incorrectly identifies the sherd as a chalice.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 287, no. 846, pl. 118) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.474j)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1983) (phase 2)
